title.narrative: Capacity Development in Land Administration Lantmäteriet/RLMUA

description.narrative: Strengthened capacity of Rwanda Land Management and Use Authority (RLMUA) to deliver efficient land administration services in accordance to the Rwanda Land Sub Sector Strategic Plan.

Lantmäteriet och Rwanda Natural Resources Authority (RNRA) Department of Lands and Mapping and Office of the Registrar (DLM) - numera Rwanda Land Management and Use Authority (RLMUA) - har ansökt om stöd för ett brett myndighetssamarbete med fokus på kapacitetsutveckling inom landadministration i Rwanda.
Samarbetet syftar övergripande till att stärka kapaciteten hos RLMUA för att myndigheten ska kunna utöva en effektiv landadministration och tillhandahålla landrelaterade tjänster i enlighet med de lagar och regelverk som finns, och implementera Rwandas Land Sub Sector Strategic Plan (LSSSP) 2013/14 – 2017/18. Fokus kommer att ligga på kapacitetsutveckling av personal genom olika typer av expertinsatser samt mentorskap, utbildningar, studiebesök och rådgivning.
Landadministration är ett prioriterat område av såväl den Rwandiske regeringen, som av Sida i utvecklingssamarbetet med Rwanda. Det är grundläggande för ökad miljömässig motståndskraft, samt för att hantera landets naturresurser och några av de mest centrala miljöutmaningarna i Rwanda, såsom landdegradering och avskogning. Att stötta myndighetssamarbetet mellan RLMUA och Lantmäteriet bedöms som ett bra sätt att uppnå resultat inom området givet organisationernas respektive mandat och unika kompetens inom landadministration.
Vilka områden och aktiviteter samarbetet mer specifikt ska fokusera på kommer att utarbetas gemensamt av både RLMUA och Lantmäteriet under en inledande fas. Parterna ämnar genomföra förberedande analyser (som har specificerats i en plan för den inledande fasen), och på basis av dessa utarbeta ett utförligt resultatramverk och en aktivitetsplan för samarbetet, med korrelerande budget. Detta avses följas upp och uppdateras årligen av parterna och i dialog med ambassaden. Detta för att behålla flexibilitet i utformningen av samarbetet, och säkerställa att det fokuserar på de områden som bedöms som mest relevanta kontinuerligt. Ansatsen är att arbeta så brett som möjligt vad gäller kapacitetsutveckling av den Rwandiska myndigheten, då ett mer holistiskt angreppssätt där hela myndigheten stöttas i genomförandet av sitt uppdrag och sitt mandat under en lång tid är att föredra.
En väl genomförd inledande fas och godkänd påföljande rapport kommer att utgöra basen för fortsatt stöd, och ambassaden avser föra en aktiv dialog med parterna under insatsens genomförande.
Det svenska stödet beräknas totalt uppgå till 37 726 112 SEK under 5 år (2017-2021).

The Swedish Mapping, Cadastral and Land Registration Authority (Lantmäteriet) and Rwanda Natural Resources Authority (RNRA) Department of Lands and Mapping and Office of the Registrar (DLM) - now Rwanda Land Management and Use Authority (RLMUA) have submitted a request for support for collaboration between the two government agencies during 2017-2021.
The overall purpose of the collaboration is to contribute to strengthened capacity of RLMUA to deliver efficient land administration services in accordance with the Rwanda Land Sub Sector Strategic Plan (LSSSP) 2013/14 – 2017/18. The intervention will contribute to overall enhanced environmental management by providing improved and more accessible and reliable information on land use, land rights and land use planning. This information is used for enhanced planning and policy development in order to improve environmental conditions and readiness to handle natural disasters, as well as sustainable management of natural resources. A well-developed and efficient public land administration authority and is a requirement to be able to protect the environment and natural resources, and is a key component in delivering environmental sustainability and address issues such as deforestation, erosion and other forms of land degradation.
The collaboration between RLMUA and Lantmäteriet will constitute a broad government agency collaboration focused on capacity development of the staff within RLMUA. Lantmäteriets expertise will be used for counselling, studies, training, curriculum development and professional development on policy, legislation, technical methods in land administration and management, organizational development, management of human resources, financial system and leadership. The activities will also include efforts to collaborate with the organisations responsible for higher education in land management in Rwanda, namely Ruhengeri Institute of Higher Education, INES Ruhengeri and the University of Rwanda, for continuous competence development of the land management sector.
Lantmäteriet and RLMUA will develop the full results framework jointly during the inception phase, including a workplan and method for monitoring and evaluation of results during the project. This will be part of a broader inception report. Continued support after the inception phase is conditioned on the Embassy's approval of the report.
The total budget amounts to 37 726 112 SEK distributed over five years (2017-2021).

tag.narrative: 1.4 - By 2030, ensure that all men and women, in particular the poor and the vulnerable, have equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to basic services, ownership and control over land and other forms of property, inheritance, natural resources, appropriate new technology and financial services, including microfinance.

1.4 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att alla män och kvinnor, i synnerhet de fattiga och de utsatta, har lika rätt till ekonomiska resurser, tillgång till grundläggande tjänster, möjlighet att äga och kontrollera mark och andra former av egendom samt tillgång till arv, naturresurser, lämplig ny teknik och finansiella tjänster, inklusive mikrokrediter.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

5.a - Genomföra reformer för att ge kvinnor lika rätt till ekonomiska resurser, möjlighet att äga och kontrollera mark och andra former av egendom samt tillgång till finansiella tjänster, arv och naturresurser, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning

5.a - Undertake reforms to give women equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to ownership and control over land and other forms of property, financial services, inheritance and natural resources, in accordance with national laws.

9.1 - Bygga ut tillförlitlig, hållbar och motståndskraftig infrastruktur av hög kvalitet, inklusive regional och gränsöverskridande infrastruktur, för att stödja ekonomisk utveckling och människors välbefinnande, med fokus på ekonomiskt överkomlig och rättvis tillgång för alla.

9.1 - Develop quality, reliable, sustainable and resilient infrastructure, including regional and transborder infrastructure, to support economic development and human well-being, with a focus on affordable and equitable access for all.

title.narrative: Amendment to the agreement on Capacity Building in Land Administration

description.narrative:
Main results achieved during 2021 according to annual narrative report
The annual report describes activities and results in relation to plans but also includes an assessment of how the activities during 2021 have contributed to the SDGs, which gives an indication of possible future impact.
SDG 11. Sustainable Cities & Communities: 11a) Strong national and regional development planning; 11.3) Inclusive and sustainable urbanization
SDG 13. Climate Action: 13.2) Integrate climate change measures into national policies, strategies and planning
Result 2021: Three District Land Use plans have been approved, and work with five more plans is ongoing. Dissemination and improvements of plans for enhanced alignment to the NLUDMP
How the result contributes to the SDG: Well substantiated and appropriate Land Use Plans are one of the corner stones towards a sustainable urban/rural development, agriculture, and for climate change actions. In the light of a predicted rapid population growth, the plans will be very important tools for making fact-based decisions on a long-term sustainable land use.
SDG 1. No Poverty: 1.4) Equal rights to ownership, basic services, technology and economic resources
SDG 5. Gender equality: 5.a) Equal rights to economic resources, property ownership and financial services.
SDG 10. Reduced inequality: 10.2) Promote universal social, economic and political inclusion
Result 2021: The project has giving financial support to broadcast 15 live radio- and TV shows which have given information to people on land matters, especially women's equal right to own land. Training of local leaders regarding land matters and womens equal right to own land.
How the result contributes to the SDG: The information targeted towards the rights for women to own land is vital towards equality and economic growth. The training of local leaders is an important activity towards educating the population of the possibility of equal tenure of land. Further on, these activities will promote social and economic inclusion of women in society.
SDG 9. Industry, Innovation & Infrastructure: 9.1) Develop quality, reliable, sustainable and resilient infrastructure.
Results 2021: Improved quality on GIS base map data and logical framework for data storage. National NSDI portal developed and officially launched in November 2021.
How the result contributes to the SDG: Accurate, reliable and systematic organization of geodata will provide a good platform for further development in different areas such as climate adaption, urban development and other land use. Access to high quality geodata is an essential part of any countrys digital infrastructure, which can be used for many different purposes that contributes to a sustainable development for Rwanda.
SDG 16. Peace, Justice & Strong Institutions: 16.6) Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions.
Result 2021: A progressed version of a sales price register. Theoretical framework further disseminated and specified. Further development of the technical parts of the system performed. Knowledge transfer and capacity building via on-the-job training and remote support. Increased awareness and knowledge among planners at RLMUA about best planning practices, planning standards, and logical structure of the plans which together have contributed to an overall increased quality in the district plans (DLUP). A more stable, robust and functional land administration information system.
The result of the several activities that will further enhance competence and transferred know-how is a vital part of working towards an effective organization but also become more transparent.
How the result contributes to the SDG: In the long-term perspective, a public sales price register will contribute to a better knowledge and transparency on the value of land and properties, which in turn can be used as a basis for making well-informed decisions for citizens and private companies. An accurate, reliable and functional land register is also a prerequisite for an effective management of land.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
